newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Ceylon Oxygen in one-for-two rights.
newsitem.headline: Ceylon Oxygen in one-for-two rights.

text.p: Ceylon Oxygen Ltd said on Wednesday it was offering a one-for-two rights issue at 60 rupees per share against its last traded price of 47.50 rupees.
It said the rights issue is fully underwritten by the company's major shareholder Norway's Norsk Hydro AS.

Ceylon Oxygen, the monopoly manufacturer of industrial and medical gases in Sri Lanka, said it was offering rights at a price higher than the stock's current market price which did not reflect its performance.
"Current market price has no bearing on the intrinsic value of the share," said a Ceylon Oxygen official, adding it only reflected depressed market conditions.
The company's net profit rose by 21 percent to 23 million rupees in the first six months of calendar 1996 from 19 million in the same 1995 period.
